intro: Pseudonephelium, commonly known as the mountain apple tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and produces yellow or orange fruits that are edible. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. The genus includes several species, with Pseudonephelium costaricense being one of the most well-known.
